scenes.text: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.

sceneText.text: FRANCISCO at his post. Enter to him BERNARDO

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Who's there?

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: Nay, answer me: stand, and unfold yourself.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Long live the king!

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: Bernardo?

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: He.

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: You come most carefully upon your hour.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: 'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: For this relief much thanks: 'tis bitter cold,

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: And I am sick at heart.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Have you had quiet guard?

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: Not a mouse stirring.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Well, good night.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: If you do meet Horatio and Marcellus,

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: The rivals of my watch, bid them make haste.

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: I think I hear them. Stand, ho! Who's there?
Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Friends to this ground.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: And liegemen to the Dane.

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: Give you good night.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: O, farewell, honest soldier:

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Who hath relieved you?

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: Bernardo has my place.

sceneText.speaker: FRANCISCO
sceneText.text: Give you good night.
Exit

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Holla! Bernardo!

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Say,

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: What, is Horatio there?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: A piece of him.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Welcome, Horatio: welcome, good Marcellus.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: What, has this thing appear'd again to-night?

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: I have seen nothing.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Horatio says 'tis but our fantasy,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: And will not let belief take hold of him

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Touching this dreaded sight, twice seen of us:

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Therefore I have entreated him along

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: With us to watch the minutes of this night;

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: That if again this apparition come,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: He may approve our eyes and speak to it.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Sit down awhile;

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: And let us once again assail your ears,

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: That are so fortified against our story

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: What we have two nights seen.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Well, sit we down,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And let us hear Bernardo speak of this.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Last night of all,

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: When yond same star that's westward from the pole

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Had made his course to illume that part of heaven

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself,

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: The bell then beating one,--
Enter Ghost

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Peace, break thee off; look, where it comes again!

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: In the same figure, like the king that's dead.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Thou art a scholar; speak to it, Horatio.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Looks it not like the king? mark it, Horatio.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: It would be spoke to.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Question it, Horatio.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What art thou that usurp'st this time of night,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Together with that fair and warlike form

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: In which the majesty of buried Denmark

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Did sometimes march? by heaven I charge thee, speak!

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: It is offended.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: See, it stalks away!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Stay! speak, speak! I charge thee, speak!
Exit Ghost

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: 'Tis gone, and will not answer.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: How now, Horatio! you tremble and look pale:

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Is not this something more than fantasy?

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: What think you on't?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Before my God, I might not this believe

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Without the sensible and true avouch

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of mine own eyes.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Is it not like the king?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As thou art to thyself:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Such was the very armour he had on

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: When he the ambitious Norway combated;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: So frown'd he once, when, in an angry parle,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: He smote the sledded Polacks on the ice.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: 'Tis strange.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Thus twice before, and jump at this dead hour,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: With martial stalk hath he gone by our watch.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: In what particular thought to work I know not;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But in the gross and scope of my opinion,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: This bodes some strange eruption to our state.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Good now, sit down, and tell me, he that knows,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Why this same strict and most observant watch

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: So nightly toils the subject of the land,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: And why such daily cast of brazen cannon,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: And foreign mart for implements of war;

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Why such impress of shipwrights, whose sore task

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Does not divide the Sunday from the week;

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: What might be toward, that this sweaty haste

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Doth make the night joint-labourer with the day:

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Who is't that can inform me?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: That can I;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: At least, the whisper goes so. Our last king,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Whose image even but now appear'd to us,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Was, as you know, by Fortinbras of Norway,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Thereto prick'd on by a most emulate pride,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Dared to the combat; in which our valiant Hamlet--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: For so this side of our known world esteem'd him--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Did slay this Fortinbras; who by a seal'd compact,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Well ratified by law and heraldry,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Did forfeit, with his life, all those his lands

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Which he stood seized of, to the conqueror:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Against the which, a moiety competent

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Was gaged by our king; which had return'd

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: To the inheritance of Fortinbras,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Had he been vanquisher; as, by the same covenant,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And carriage of the article design'd,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: His fell to Hamlet. Now, sir, young Fortinbras,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of unimproved mettle hot and full,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Hath in the skirts of Norway here and there

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Shark'd up a list of lawless resolutes,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: For food and diet, to some enterprise

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: That hath a stomach in't; which is no other--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As it doth well appear unto our state--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But to recover of us, by strong hand

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: So by his father lost: and this, I take it,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Is the main motive of our preparations,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The source of this our watch and the chief head

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of this post-haste and romage in the land.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: I think it be no other but e'en so:

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Well may it sort that this portentous figure

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Comes armed through our watch; so like the king

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: That was and is the question of these wars.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: A mote it is to trouble the mind's eye.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: In the most high and palmy state of Rome,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: A little ere the mightiest Julius fell,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The graves stood tenantless and the sheeted dead

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Disasters in the sun; and the moist star

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And even the like precurse of fierce events,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As harbingers preceding still the fates

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And prologue to the omen coming on,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Have heaven and earth together demonstrated

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Unto our climatures and countrymen.--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But soft, behold! lo, where it comes again!
Re-enter Ghost

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I'll cross it, though it blast me. Stay, illusion!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: If thou hast any sound, or use of voice,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Speak to me:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: If there be any good thing to be done,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: That may to thee do ease and grace to me,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Speak to me:
Cock crows

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: If thou art privy to thy country's fate,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Which, happily, foreknowing may avoid, O, speak!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Or if thou hast uphoarded in thy life

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Extorted treasure in the womb of earth,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: For which, they say, you spirits oft walk in death,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Speak of it: stay, and speak! Stop it, Marcellus.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Shall I strike at it with my partisan?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Do, if it will not stand.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: 'Tis here!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: 'Tis here!

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: 'Tis gone!
Exit Ghost

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: We do it wrong, being so majestical,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: To offer it the show of violence;

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: For it is, as the air, invulnerable,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: And our vain blows malicious mockery.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: It was about to speak, when the cock crew.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And then it started like a guilty thing

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Upon a fearful summons. I have heard,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The cock, that is the trumpet to the morn,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Doth with his lofty and shrill-sounding throat

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Awake the god of day; and, at his warning,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Whether in sea or fire, in earth or air,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The extravagant and erring spirit hies

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: To his confine: and of the truth herein

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: This present object made probation.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: It faded on the crowing of the cock.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Wherein our Saviour's birth is celebrated,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: The bird of dawning singeth all night long:

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: And then, they say, no spirit dares stir abroad;

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: The nights are wholesome; then no planets strike,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: No fairy takes, nor witch hath power to charm,

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: So hallow'd and so gracious is the time.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: So have I heard and do in part believe it.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But, look, the morn, in russet mantle clad,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Walks o'er the dew of yon high eastward hill:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Break we our watch up; and by my advice,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Let us impart what we have seen to-night

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Unto young Hamlet; for, upon my life,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: This spirit, dumb to us, will speak to him.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Do you consent we shall acquaint him with it,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As needful in our loves, fitting our duty?

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Let's do't, I pray; and I this morning know

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Where we shall find him most conveniently.
Exeunt

scenes.text: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.

sceneText.text: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, HAMLET, POLONIUS, LAERTES, VOLTIMAND, CORNELIUS, Lords, and Attendants

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Though yet of Hamlet our dear brother's death

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The memory be green, and that it us befitted

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To bear our hearts in grief and our whole kingdom

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To be contracted in one brow of woe,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Yet so far hath discretion fought with nature

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That we with wisest sorrow think on him,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Together with remembrance of ourselves.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Therefore our sometime sister, now our queen,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The imperial jointress to this warlike state,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Have we, as 'twere with a defeated joy,--

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: With an auspicious and a dropping eye,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: With mirth in funeral and with dirge in marriage,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In equal scale weighing delight and dole,--

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Taken to wife: nor have we herein barr'd

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Your better wisdoms, which have freely gone

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: With this affair along. For all, our thanks.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Now follows, that you know, young Fortinbras,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Holding a weak supposal of our worth,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Or thinking by our late dear brother's death

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Our state to be disjoint and out of frame,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Colleagued with the dream of his advantage,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: He hath not fail'd to pester us with message,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Importing the surrender of those lands

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Lost by his father, with all bonds of law,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To our most valiant brother. So much for him.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Now for ourself and for this time of meeting:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Thus much the business is: we have here writ

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To Norway, uncle of young Fortinbras,--

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Who, impotent and bed-rid, scarcely hears

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Of this his nephew's purpose,--to suppress

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: His further gait herein; in that the levies,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The lists and full proportions, are all made

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Out of his subject: and we here dispatch

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: You, good Cornelius, and you, Voltimand,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: For bearers of this greeting to old Norway;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Giving to you no further personal power

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To business with the king, more than the scope

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Of these delated articles allow.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Farewell, and let your haste commend your duty.

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: In that and all things will we show our duty.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: We doubt it nothing: heartily farewell.
Exeunt VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And now, Laertes, what's the news with you?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: You told us of some suit; what is't, Laertes?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: You cannot speak of reason to the Dane,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And loose your voice: what wouldst thou beg, Laertes,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That shall not be my offer, not thy asking?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The head is not more native to the heart,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The hand more instrumental to the mouth,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Than is the throne of Denmark to thy father.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: What wouldst thou have, Laertes?

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: My dread lord,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Your leave and favour to return to France;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: From whence though willingly I came to Denmark,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: To show my duty in your coronation,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Yet now, I must confess, that duty done,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: My thoughts and wishes bend again toward France

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And bow them to your gracious leave and pardon.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Have you your father's leave? What says Polonius?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: He hath, my lord, wrung from me my slow leave

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: By laboursome petition, and at last

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Upon his will I seal'd my hard consent:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I do beseech you, give him leave to go.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Take thy fair hour, Laertes; time be thine,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And thy best graces spend it at thy will!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: But now, my cousin Hamlet, and my son,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: [Aside] A little more than kin, and less than kind.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: How is it that the clouds still hang on you?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Not so, my lord; I am too much i' the sun.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Good Hamlet, cast thy nighted colour off,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: And let thine eye look like a friend on Denmark.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Do not for ever with thy vailed lids

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Seek for thy noble father in the dust:

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Thou know'st 'tis common; all that lives must die,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Passing through nature to eternity.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, madam, it is common.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: If it be,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Why seems it so particular with thee?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Seems, madam! nay it is; I know not 'seems.'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Tis not alone my inky cloak, good mother,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nor customary suits of solemn black,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nor windy suspiration of forced breath,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, nor the fruitful river in the eye,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nor the dejected 'havior of the visage,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Together with all forms, moods, shapes of grief,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That can denote me truly: these indeed seem,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For they are actions that a man might play:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But I have that within which passeth show;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: These but the trappings and the suits of woe.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: 'Tis sweet and commendable in your nature, Hamlet,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To give these mourning duties to your father:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: But, you must know, your father lost a father;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That father lost, lost his, and the survivor bound

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In filial obligation for some term

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To do obsequious sorrow: but to persever

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In obstinate condolement is a course

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Of impious stubbornness; 'tis unmanly grief;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: It shows a will most incorrect to heaven,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: A heart unfortified, a mind impatient,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: An understanding simple and unschool'd:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: For what we know must be and is as common

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: As any the most vulgar thing to sense,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Why should we in our peevish opposition

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Take it to heart? Fie! 'tis a fault to heaven,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: A fault against the dead, a fault to nature,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To reason most absurd: whose common theme

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Is death of fathers, and who still hath cried,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: From the first corse till he that died to-day,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: 'This must be so.' We pray you, throw to earth

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: This unprevailing woe, and think of us

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: As of a father: for let the world take note,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: You are the most immediate to our throne;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And with no less nobility of love

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Than that which dearest father bears his son,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Do I impart toward you. For your intent

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In going back to school in Wittenberg,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: It is most retrograde to our desire:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And we beseech you, bend you to remain

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Here, in the cheer and comfort of our eye,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Our chiefest courtier, cousin, and our son.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Let not thy mother lose her prayers, Hamlet:

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: I pray thee, stay with us; go not to Wittenberg.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I shall in all my best obey you, madam.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Why, 'tis a loving and a fair reply:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Be as ourself in Denmark. Madam, come;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: This gentle and unforced accord of Hamlet

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Sits smiling to my heart: in grace whereof,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: No jocund health that Denmark drinks to-day,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: But the great cannon to the clouds shall tell,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And the king's rouse the heavens all bruit again,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Re-speaking earthly thunder. Come away.
Exeunt all but HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, that this too too solid flesh would melt

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thaw and resolve itself into a dew!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or that the Everlasting had not fix'd

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: His canon 'gainst self-slaughter! O God! God!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How weary, stale, flat and unprofitable,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Seem to me all the uses of this world!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Fie on't! ah fie! 'tis an unweeded garden,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That grows to seed; things rank and gross in nature

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Possess it merely. That it should come to this!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But two months dead: nay, not so much, not two:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So excellent a king; that was, to this,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hyperion to a satyr; so loving to my mother

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That he might not beteem the winds of heaven

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Visit her face too roughly. Heaven and earth!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Must I remember? why, she would hang on him,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As if increase of appetite had grown

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: By what it fed on: and yet, within a month--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let me not think on't--Frailty, thy name is woman!--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A little month, or ere those shoes were old

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With which she follow'd my poor father's body,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Like Niobe, all tears:--why she, even she--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, God! a beast, that wants discourse of reason,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Would have mourn'd longer--married with my uncle,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My father's brother, but no more like my father

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Than I to Hercules: within a month:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ere yet the salt of most unrighteous tears

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Had left the flushing in her galled eyes,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: She married. O, most wicked speed, to post

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With such dexterity to incestuous sheets!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It is not nor it cannot come to good:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But break, my heart; for I must hold my tongue.
Enter HORATIO, MARCELLUS, and BERNARDO

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Hail to your lordship!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I am glad to see you well:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Horatio,--or I do forget myself.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The same, my lord, and your poor servant ever.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, my good friend; I'll change that name with you:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And what make you from Wittenberg, Horatio? Marcellus?

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: My good lord--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I am very glad to see you. Good even, sir.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But what, in faith, make you from Wittenberg?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: A truant disposition, good my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I would not hear your enemy say so,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nor shall you do mine ear that violence,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To make it truster of your own report

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Against yourself: I know you are no truant.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But what is your affair in Elsinore?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: We'll teach you to drink deep ere you depart.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: My lord, I came to see your father's funeral.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I pray thee, do not mock me, fellow-student;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I think it was to see my mother's wedding.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Indeed, my lord, it follow'd hard upon.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thrift, thrift, Horatio! the funeral baked meats

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Did coldly furnish forth the marriage tables.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Would I had met my dearest foe in heaven

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or ever I had seen that day, Horatio!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My father!--methinks I see my father.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Where, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: In my mind's eye, Horatio.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I saw him once; he was a goodly king.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He was a man, take him for all in all,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I shall not look upon his like again.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: My lord, I think I saw him yesternight.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Saw? who?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: My lord, the king your father.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The king my father!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Season your admiration for awhile

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: With an attent ear, till I may deliver,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Upon the witness of these gentlemen,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: This marvel to you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For God's love, let me hear.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Two nights together had these gentlemen,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Marcellus and Bernardo, on their watch,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: In the dead vast and middle of the night,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Been thus encounter'd. A figure like your father,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Armed at point exactly, cap-a-pe,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Appears before them, and with solemn march

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Goes slow and stately by them: thrice he walk'd

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: By their oppress'd and fear-surprised eyes,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Within his truncheon's length; whilst they, distilled

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Almost to jelly with the act of fear,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Stand dumb and speak not to him. This to me

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: In dreadful secrecy impart they did;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And I with them the third night kept the watch;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Where, as they had deliver'd, both in time,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Form of the thing, each word made true and good,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The apparition comes: I knew your father;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: These hands are not more like.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But where was this?

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: My lord, upon the platform where we watch'd.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Did you not speak to it?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: My lord, I did;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But answer made it none: yet once methought

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It lifted up its head and did address

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Itself to motion, like as it would speak;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But even then the morning cock crew loud,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And at the sound it shrunk in haste away,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And vanish'd from our sight.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Tis very strange.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As I do live, my honour'd lord, 'tis true;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And we did think it writ down in our duty

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: To let you know of it.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Indeed, indeed, sirs, but this troubles me.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hold you the watch to-night?

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: We do, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Arm'd, say you?

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Arm'd, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: From top to toe?

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: My lord, from head to foot.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then saw you not his face?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: O, yes, my lord; he wore his beaver up.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What, look'd he frowningly?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: A countenance more in sorrow than in anger.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Pale or red?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Nay, very pale.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And fix'd his eyes upon you?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Most constantly.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I would I had been there.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It would have much amazed you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Very like, very like. Stay'd it long?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: While one with moderate haste might tell a hundred.

sceneText.speaker: BERNARDO
sceneText.text: Longer, longer.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Not when I saw't.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: His beard was grizzled--no?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It was, as I have seen it in his life,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: A sable silver'd.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I will watch to-night;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Perchance 'twill walk again.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I warrant it will.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If it assume my noble father's person,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll speak to it, though hell itself should gape

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And bid me hold my peace. I pray you all,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If you have hitherto conceal'd this sight,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let it be tenable in your silence still;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And whatsoever else shall hap to-night,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Give it an understanding, but no tongue:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I will requite your loves. So, fare you well:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Upon the platform, 'twixt eleven and twelve,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll visit you.

sceneText.speaker: All
sceneText.text: Our duty to your honour.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Your loves, as mine to you: farewell.
Exeunt all but HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My father's spirit in arms! all is not well;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I doubt some foul play: would the night were come!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Till then sit still, my soul: foul deeds will rise,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Though all the earth o'erwhelm them, to men's eyes.
Exit

scenes.text: SCENE III. A room in Polonius' house.

sceneText.text: Enter LAERTES and OPHELIA

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: My necessaries are embark'd: farewell:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And, sister, as the winds give benefit

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And convoy is assistant, do not sleep,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: But let me hear from you.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Do you doubt that?

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: For Hamlet and the trifling of his favour,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Hold it a fashion and a toy in blood,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: A violet in the youth of primy nature,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Forward, not permanent, sweet, not lasting,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The perfume and suppliance of a minute; No more.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: No more but so?

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Think it no more;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: For nature, crescent, does not grow alone

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: In thews and bulk, but, as this temple waxes,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The inward service of the mind and soul

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Grows wide withal. Perhaps he loves you now,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And now no soil nor cautel doth besmirch

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The virtue of his will: but you must fear,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: His greatness weigh'd, his will is not his own;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: For he himself is subject to his birth:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: He may not, as unvalued persons do,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Carve for himself; for on his choice depends

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The safety and health of this whole state;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And therefore must his choice be circumscribed

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Unto the voice and yielding of that body

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Whereof he is the head. Then if he says he loves you,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: It fits your wisdom so far to believe it

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: As he in his particular act and place

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: May give his saying deed; which is no further

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Than the main voice of Denmark goes withal.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Then weigh what loss your honour may sustain,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: If with too credent ear you list his songs,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Or lose your heart, or your chaste treasure open

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: To his unmaster'd importunity.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Fear it, Ophelia, fear it, my dear sister,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And keep you in the rear of your affection,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Out of the shot and danger of desire.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The chariest maid is prodigal enough,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: If she unmask her beauty to the moon:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Virtue itself 'scapes not calumnious strokes:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The canker galls the infants of the spring,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Too oft before their buttons be disclosed,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And in the morn and liquid dew of youth

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Contagious blastments are most imminent.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Be wary then; best safety lies in fear:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Youth to itself rebels, though none else near.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: I shall the effect of this good lesson keep,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: As watchman to my heart. But, good my brother,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Do not, as some ungracious pastors do,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Show me the steep and thorny way to heaven;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Whiles, like a puff'd and reckless libertine,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Himself the primrose path of dalliance treads,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And recks not his own rede.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: O, fear me not.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I stay too long: but here my father comes.
Enter POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: A double blessing is a double grace,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Occasion smiles upon a second leave.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Yet here, Laertes! aboard, aboard, for shame!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The wind sits in the shoulder of your sail,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And you are stay'd for. There; my blessing with thee!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And these few precepts in thy memory

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: See thou character. Give thy thoughts no tongue,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Nor any unproportioned thought his act.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Be thou familiar, but by no means vulgar.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Those friends thou hast, and their adoption tried,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Grapple them to thy soul with hoops of steel;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But do not dull thy palm with entertainment

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Of each new-hatch'd, unfledged comrade. Beware

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Of entrance to a quarrel, but being in,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Bear't that the opposed may beware of thee.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Give every man thy ear, but few thy voice;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Take each man's censure, but reserve thy judgment.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Costly thy habit as thy purse can buy,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But not express'd in fancy; rich, not gaudy;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: For the apparel oft proclaims the man,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And they in France of the best rank and station

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Are of a most select and generous chief in that.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Neither a borrower nor a lender be;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: For loan oft loses both itself and friend,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And borrowing dulls the edge of husbandry.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: This above all: to thine ownself be true,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And it must follow, as the night the day,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Thou canst not then be false to any man.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Farewell: my blessing season this in thee!

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Most humbly do I take my leave, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The time invites you; go; your servants tend.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Farewell, Ophelia; and remember well

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: What I have said to you.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: 'Tis in my memory lock'd,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And you yourself shall keep the key of it.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Farewell.
Exit

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What is't, Ophelia, be hath said to you?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: So please you, something touching the Lord Hamlet.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Marry, well bethought:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'Tis told me, he hath very oft of late

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Given private time to you; and you yourself

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Have of your audience been most free and bounteous:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: If it be so, as so 'tis put on me,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And that in way of caution, I must tell you,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You do not understand yourself so clearly

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As it behoves my daughter and your honour.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What is between you? give me up the truth.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: He hath, my lord, of late made many tenders

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Of his affection to me.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Affection! pooh! you speak like a green girl,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Unsifted in such perilous circumstance.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Do you believe his tenders, as you call them?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: I do not know, my lord, what I should think.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Marry, I'll teach you: think yourself a baby;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That you have ta'en these tenders for true pay,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Which are not sterling. Tender yourself more dearly;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Or--not to crack the wind of the poor phrase,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Running it thus--you'll tender me a fool.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: My lord, he hath importuned me with love

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: In honourable fashion.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Ay, fashion you may call it; go to, go to.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And hath given countenance to his speech, my lord,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: With almost all the holy vows of heaven.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Ay, springes to catch woodcocks. I do know,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: When the blood burns, how prodigal the soul

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Lends the tongue vows: these blazes, daughter,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Giving more light than heat, extinct in both,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Even in their promise, as it is a-making,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You must not take for fire. From this time

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Be somewhat scanter of your maiden presence;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Set your entreatments at a higher rate

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Than a command to parley. For Lord Hamlet,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Believe so much in him, that he is young

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And with a larger tether may he walk

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Than may be given you: in few, Ophelia,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Do not believe his vows; for they are brokers,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Not of that dye which their investments show,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But mere implorators of unholy suits,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Breathing like sanctified and pious bawds,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The better to beguile. This is for all:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I would not, in plain terms, from this time forth,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Have you so slander any moment leisure,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As to give words or talk with the Lord Hamlet.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Look to't, I charge you: come your ways.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: I shall obey, my lord.
Exeunt

scenes.text: SCENE IV. The platform.

sceneText.text: Enter HAMLET, HORATIO, and MARCELLUS

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The air bites shrewdly; it is very cold.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It is a nipping and an eager air.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What hour now?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I think it lacks of twelve.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, it is struck.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Indeed? I heard it not: then it draws near the season

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Wherein the spirit held his wont to walk.
A flourish of trumpets, and ordnance shot off, within

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What does this mean, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The king doth wake to-night and takes his rouse,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Keeps wassail, and the swaggering up-spring reels;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And, as he drains his draughts of Rhenish down,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The kettle-drum and trumpet thus bray out

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The triumph of his pledge.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Is it a custom?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, marry, is't:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But to my mind, though I am native here

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And to the manner born, it is a custom

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: More honour'd in the breach than the observance.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This heavy-headed revel east and west

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Makes us traduced and tax'd of other nations:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: They clepe us drunkards, and with swinish phrase

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Soil our addition; and indeed it takes

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: From our achievements, though perform'd at height,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The pith and marrow of our attribute.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So, oft it chances in particular men,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That for some vicious mole of nature in them,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As, in their birth--wherein they are not guilty,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Since nature cannot choose his origin--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: By the o'ergrowth of some complexion,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Oft breaking down the pales and forts of reason,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or by some habit that too much o'er-leavens

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The form of plausive manners, that these men,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Carrying, I say, the stamp of one defect,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Being nature's livery, or fortune's star,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Their virtues else--be they as pure as grace,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As infinite as man may undergo--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Shall in the general censure take corruption

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: From that particular fault: the dram of eale

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Doth all the noble substance of a doubt

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To his own scandal.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Look, my lord, it comes!
Enter Ghost

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Angels and ministers of grace defend us!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Be thou a spirit of health or goblin damn'd,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Bring with thee airs from heaven or blasts from hell,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Be thy intents wicked or charitable,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thou comest in such a questionable shape

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That I will speak to thee: I'll call thee Hamlet,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: King, father, royal Dane: O, answer me!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let me not burst in ignorance; but tell

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why thy canonized bones, hearsed in death,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Have burst their cerements; why the sepulchre,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Wherein we saw thee quietly inurn'd,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hath oped his ponderous and marble jaws,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To cast thee up again. What may this mean,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That thou, dead corse, again in complete steel

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Revisit'st thus the glimpses of the moon,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Making night hideous; and we fools of nature

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So horridly to shake our disposition

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With thoughts beyond the reaches of our souls?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Say, why is this? wherefore? what should we do?
Ghost beckons HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It beckons you to go away with it,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: As if it some impartment did desire

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: To you alone.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Look, with what courteous action

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: It waves you to a more removed ground:

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: But do not go with it.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: No, by no means.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It will not speak; then I will follow it.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Do not, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, what should be the fear?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I do not set my life in a pin's fee;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And for my soul, what can it do to that,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Being a thing immortal as itself?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It waves me forth again: I'll follow it.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What if it tempt you toward the flood, my lord,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Or to the dreadful summit of the cliff

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: That beetles o'er his base into the sea,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And there assume some other horrible form,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Which might deprive your sovereignty of reason

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And draw you into madness? think of it:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: The very place puts toys of desperation,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Without more motive, into every brain

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: That looks so many fathoms to the sea

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And hears it roar beneath.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It waves me still.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Go on; I'll follow thee.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: You shall not go, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hold off your hands.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Be ruled; you shall not go.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My fate cries out,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And makes each petty artery in this body

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As hardy as the Nemean lion's nerve.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Still am I call'd. Unhand me, gentlemen.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: By heaven, I'll make a ghost of him that lets me!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I say, away! Go on; I'll follow thee.
Exeunt Ghost and HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: He waxes desperate with imagination.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Let's follow; 'tis not fit thus to obey him.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Have after. To what issue will this come?

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Heaven will direct it.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Nay, let's follow him.
Exeunt

scenes.text: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.

sceneText.text: Enter GHOST and HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Where wilt thou lead me? speak; I'll go no further.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Mark me.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I will.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: My hour is almost come,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: When I to sulphurous and tormenting flames

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Must render up myself.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Alas, poor ghost!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Pity me not, but lend thy serious hearing

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: To what I shall unfold.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Speak; I am bound to hear.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: So art thou to revenge, when thou shalt hear.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What?

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: I am thy father's spirit,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Doom'd for a certain term to walk the night,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And for the day confined to fast in fires,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Till the foul crimes done in my days of nature

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Are burnt and purged away. But that I am forbid

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: To tell the secrets of my prison-house,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: I could a tale unfold whose lightest word

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Would harrow up thy soul, freeze thy young blood,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Make thy two eyes, like stars, start from their spheres,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Thy knotted and combined locks to part

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And each particular hair to stand on end,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Like quills upon the fretful porpentine:

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: But this eternal blazon must not be

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: To ears of flesh and blood. List, list, O, list!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: If thou didst ever thy dear father love--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O God!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Revenge his foul and most unnatural murder.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Murder!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Murder most foul, as in the best it is;

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: But this most foul, strange and unnatural.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Haste me to know't, that I, with wings as swift

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As meditation or the thoughts of love,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: May sweep to my revenge.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: I find thee apt;

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And duller shouldst thou be than the fat weed

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: That roots itself in ease on Lethe wharf,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Wouldst thou not stir in this. Now, Hamlet, hear:

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: 'Tis given out that, sleeping in my orchard,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: A serpent stung me; so the whole ear of Denmark

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Is by a forged process of my death

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Rankly abused: but know, thou noble youth,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: The serpent that did sting thy father's life

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Now wears his crown.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O my prophetic soul! My uncle!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Ay, that incestuous, that adulterate beast,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: With witchcraft of his wit, with traitorous gifts,--

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: O wicked wit and gifts, that have the power

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: So to seduce!--won to his shameful lust

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: The will of my most seeming-virtuous queen:

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: O Hamlet, what a falling-off was there!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: From me, whose love was of that dignity

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: That it went hand in hand even with the vow

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: I made to her in marriage, and to decline

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Upon a wretch whose natural gifts were poor

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: To those of mine!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: But virtue, as it never will be moved,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Though lewdness court it in a shape of heaven,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: So lust, though to a radiant angel link'd,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Will sate itself in a celestial bed,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And prey on garbage.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: But, soft! methinks I scent the morning air;

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Brief let me be. Sleeping within my orchard,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: My custom always of the afternoon,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Upon my secure hour thy uncle stole,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: With juice of cursed hebenon in a vial,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And in the porches of my ears did pour

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: The leperous distilment; whose effect

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Holds such an enmity with blood of man

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: That swift as quicksilver it courses through

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: The natural gates and alleys of the body,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And with a sudden vigour doth posset

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And curd, like eager droppings into milk,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: The thin and wholesome blood: so did it mine;

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And a most instant tetter bark'd about,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Most lazar-like, with vile and loathsome crust,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: All my smooth body.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Thus was I, sleeping, by a brother's hand

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Of life, of crown, of queen, at once dispatch'd:

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Cut off even in the blossoms of my sin,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Unhousel'd, disappointed, unanel'd,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: No reckoning made, but sent to my account

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: With all my imperfections on my head:

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: O, horrible! O, horrible! most horrible!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: If thou hast nature in thee, bear it not;

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Let not the royal bed of Denmark be

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: A couch for luxury and damned incest.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: But, howsoever thou pursuest this act,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Taint not thy mind, nor let thy soul contrive

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Against thy mother aught: leave her to heaven

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And to those thorns that in her bosom lodge,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: To prick and sting her. Fare thee well at once!

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: The glow-worm shows the matin to be near,

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: And 'gins to pale his uneffectual fire:

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: Adieu, adieu! Hamlet, remember me.
Exit

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O all you host of heaven! O earth! what else?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And shall I couple hell? O, fie! Hold, hold, my heart;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And you, my sinews, grow not instant old,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But bear me stiffly up. Remember thee!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, thou poor ghost, while memory holds a seat

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: In this distracted globe. Remember thee!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Yea, from the table of my memory

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll wipe away all trivial fond records,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: All saws of books, all forms, all pressures past,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That youth and observation copied there;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And thy commandment all alone shall live

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Within the book and volume of my brain,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Unmix'd with baser matter: yes, by heaven!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O most pernicious woman!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O villain, villain, smiling, damned villain!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My tables,--meet it is I set it down,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That one may smile, and smile, and be a villain;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: At least I'm sure it may be so in Denmark:
Writing

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So, uncle, there you are. Now to my word;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It is 'Adieu, adieu! remember me.'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I have sworn 't.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: [Within] My lord, my lord,--

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: [Within] Lord Hamlet,--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: [Within] Heaven secure him!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So be it!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: [Within] Hillo, ho, ho, my lord!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hillo, ho, ho, boy! come, bird, come.
Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: How is't, my noble lord?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What news, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, wonderful!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Good my lord, tell it.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No; you'll reveal it.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Not I, my lord, by heaven.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Nor I, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How say you, then; would heart of man once think it?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But you'll be secret?

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Ay, by heaven, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: There's ne'er a villain dwelling in all Denmark

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But he's an arrant knave.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: There needs no ghost, my lord, come from the grave

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: To tell us this.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, right; you are i' the right;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And so, without more circumstance at all,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I hold it fit that we shake hands and part:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You, as your business and desire shall point you;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For every man has business and desire,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Such as it is; and for mine own poor part,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Look you, I'll go pray.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: These are but wild and whirling words, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'm sorry they offend you, heartily;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Yes, 'faith heartily.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: There's no offence, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Yes, by Saint Patrick, but there is, Horatio,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And much offence too. Touching this vision here,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It is an honest ghost, that let me tell you:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For your desire to know what is between us,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O'ermaster 't as you may. And now, good friends,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As you are friends, scholars and soldiers,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Give me one poor request.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What is't, my lord? we will.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Never make known what you have seen to-night.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: My lord, we will not.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nay, but swear't.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: In faith,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: My lord, not I.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: Nor I, my lord, in faith.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Upon my sword.

sceneText.speaker: MARCELLUS
sceneText.text: We have sworn, my lord, already.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Indeed, upon my sword, indeed.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: [Beneath] Swear.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ah, ha, boy! say'st thou so? art thou there,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: truepenny?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Come on--you hear this fellow in the cellarage--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Consent to swear.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Propose the oath, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Never to speak of this that you have seen,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Swear by my sword.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: [Beneath] Swear.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hic et ubique? then we'll shift our ground.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Come hither, gentlemen,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And lay your hands again upon my sword:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Never to speak of this that you have heard,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Swear by my sword.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: [Beneath] Swear.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Well said, old mole! canst work i' the earth so fast?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A worthy pioner! Once more remove, good friends.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: O day and night, but this is wondrous strange!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And therefore as a stranger give it welcome.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Than are dreamt of in your philosophy. But come;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Here, as before, never, so help you mercy,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How strange or odd soe'er I bear myself,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As I perchance hereafter shall think meet

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To put an antic disposition on,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That you, at such times seeing me, never shall,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With arms encumber'd thus, or this headshake,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or by pronouncing of some doubtful phrase,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As 'Well, well, we know,' or 'We could, an if we would,'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or 'If we list to speak,' or 'There be, an if they might,'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or such ambiguous giving out, to note

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That you know aught of me: this not to do,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So grace and mercy at your most need help you, Swear.

sceneText.speaker: Ghost
sceneText.text: [Beneath] Swear.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Rest, rest, perturbed spirit!
They swear

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So, gentlemen,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With all my love I do commend me to you:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And what so poor a man as Hamlet is

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: May do, to express his love and friending to you,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: God willing, shall not lack. Let us go in together;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And still your fingers on your lips, I pray.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The time is out of joint: O cursed spite,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That ever I was born to set it right!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nay, come, let's go together.
Exeunt

scenes.text: SCENE I. A room in POLONIUS' house.

sceneText.text: Enter POLONIUS and REYNALDO

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Give him this money and these notes, Reynaldo.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: I will, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You shall do marvellous wisely, good Reynaldo,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Before you visit him, to make inquire

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Of his behavior.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: My lord, I did intend it.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Marry, well said; very well said. Look you, sir,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Inquire me first what Danskers are in Paris;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And how, and who, what means, and where they keep,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What company, at what expense; and finding

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: By this encompassment and drift of question

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That they do know my son, come you more nearer

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Than your particular demands will touch it:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Take you, as 'twere, some distant knowledge of him;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As thus, 'I know his father and his friends,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And in part him: ' do you mark this, Reynaldo?

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: Ay, very well, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'And in part him; but' you may say 'not well:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But, if't be he I mean, he's very wild;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Addicted so and so:' and there put on him

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What forgeries you please; marry, none so rank

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As may dishonour him; take heed of that;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But, sir, such wanton, wild and usual slips

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As are companions noted and most known

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: To youth and liberty.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: As gaming, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Ay, or drinking, fencing, swearing, quarrelling,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Drabbing: you may go so far.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: My lord, that would dishonour him.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
