sceneText.text: 'Faith, no; as you may season it in the charge

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You must not put another scandal on him,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That he is open to incontinency;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That's not my meaning: but breathe his faults so quaintly

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That they may seem the taints of liberty,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The flash and outbreak of a fiery mind,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: A savageness in unreclaimed blood,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Of general assault.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: But, my good lord,--

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Wherefore should you do this?

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: Ay, my lord,

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: I would know that.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Marry, sir, here's my drift;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And I believe, it is a fetch of wit:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You laying these slight sullies on my son,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As 'twere a thing a little soil'd i' the working, Mark you,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Your party in converse, him you would sound,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Having ever seen in the prenominate crimes

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The youth you breathe of guilty, be assured

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: He closes with you in this consequence;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'Good sir,' or so, or 'friend,' or 'gentleman,'

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: According to the phrase or the addition

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Of man and country.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: Very good, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And then, sir, does he this--he does--what was I

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: about to say? By the mass, I was about to say

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: something: where did I leave?

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: At 'closes in the consequence,' at 'friend or so,'

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: and 'gentleman.'

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: At 'closes in the consequence,' ay, marry;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: He closes thus: 'I know the gentleman;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I saw him yesterday, or t' other day,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Or then, or then; with such, or such; and, as you say,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: There was a' gaming; there o'ertook in's rouse;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: There falling out at tennis:' or perchance,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'I saw him enter such a house of sale,'

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Videlicet, a brothel, or so forth.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: See you now;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Your bait of falsehood takes this carp of truth:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And thus do we of wisdom and of reach,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: With windlasses and with assays of bias,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: By indirections find directions out:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: So by my former lecture and advice,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Shall you my son. You have me, have you not?

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: My lord, I have.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: God be wi' you; fare you well.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: Good my lord!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Observe his inclination in yourself.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: I shall, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And let him ply his music.

sceneText.speaker: REYNALDO
sceneText.text: Well, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Farewell!
Exit REYNALDO
Enter OPHELIA

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: How now, Ophelia! what's the matter?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: O, my lord, my lord, I have been so affrighted!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: With what, i' the name of God?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: My lord, as I was sewing in my closet,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Lord Hamlet, with his doublet all unbraced;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: No hat upon his head; his stockings foul'd,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Ungarter'd, and down-gyved to his ancle;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Pale as his shirt; his knees knocking each other;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And with a look so piteous in purport

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: As if he had been loosed out of hell

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: To speak of horrors,--he comes before me.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Mad for thy love?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: My lord, I do not know;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: But truly, I do fear it.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What said he?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: He took me by the wrist and held me hard;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Then goes he to the length of all his arm;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And, with his other hand thus o'er his brow,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: He falls to such perusal of my face

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: As he would draw it. Long stay'd he so;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: At last, a little shaking of mine arm

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And thrice his head thus waving up and down,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: He raised a sigh so piteous and profound

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: As it did seem to shatter all his bulk

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And end his being: that done, he lets me go:

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And, with his head over his shoulder turn'd,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: He seem'd to find his way without his eyes;

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: For out o' doors he went without their helps,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: And, to the last, bended their light on me.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Come, go with me: I will go seek the king.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: This is the very ecstasy of love,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Whose violent property fordoes itself

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And leads the will to desperate undertakings

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As oft as any passion under heaven

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That does afflict our natures. I am sorry.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What, have you given him any hard words of late?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: No, my good lord, but, as you did command,

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: I did repel his fetters and denied

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: His access to me.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That hath made him mad.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I am sorry that with better heed and judgment

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I had not quoted him: I fear'd he did but trifle,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And meant to wreck thee; but, beshrew my jealousy!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: By heaven, it is as proper to our age

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: To cast beyond ourselves in our opinions

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As it is common for the younger sort

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: To lack discretion. Come, go we to the king:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: This must be known; which, being kept close, might

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: move

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: More grief to hide than hate to utter love.
Exeunt

scenes.text: SCENE II. A room in the castle.

sceneText.text: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and Attendants

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Welcome, dear Rosencrantz and Guildenstern!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Moreover that we much did long to see you,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The need we have to use you did provoke

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Our hasty sending. Something have you heard

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Of Hamlet's transformation; so call it,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Sith nor the exterior nor the inward man

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Resembles that it was. What it should be,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: More than his father's death, that thus hath put him

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: So much from the understanding of himself,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I cannot dream of: I entreat you both,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That, being of so young days brought up with him,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And sith so neighbour'd to his youth and havior,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That you vouchsafe your rest here in our court

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Some little time: so by your companies

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To draw him on to pleasures, and to gather,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: So much as from occasion you may glean,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Whether aught, to us unknown, afflicts him thus,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That, open'd, lies within our remedy.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Good gentlemen, he hath much talk'd of you;

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: And sure I am two men there are not living

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: To whom he more adheres. If it will please you

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: To show us so much gentry and good will

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: As to expend your time with us awhile,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: For the supply and profit of our hope,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Your visitation shall receive such thanks

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: As fits a king's remembrance.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Both your majesties

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Might, by the sovereign power you have of us,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Put your dread pleasures more into command

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Than to entreaty.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: But we both obey,

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: And here give up ourselves, in the full bent

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: To lay our service freely at your feet,

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: To be commanded.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Thanks, Rosencrantz and gentle Guildenstern.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Thanks, Guildenstern and gentle Rosencrantz:

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: And I beseech you instantly to visit

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: My too much changed son. Go, some of you,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: And bring these gentlemen where Hamlet is.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Heavens make our presence and our practises

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Pleasant and helpful to him!

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Ay, amen!
Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and some Attendants
Enter POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The ambassadors from Norway, my good lord,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Are joyfully return'd.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Thou still hast been the father of good news.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Have I, my lord? I assure my good liege,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I hold my duty, as I hold my soul,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Both to my God and to my gracious king:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And I do think, or else this brain of mine

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Hunts not the trail of policy so sure

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As it hath used to do, that I have found

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The very cause of Hamlet's lunacy.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: O, speak of that; that do I long to hear.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Give first admittance to the ambassadors;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: My news shall be the fruit to that great feast.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Thyself do grace to them, and bring them in.
Exit POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: He tells me, my dear Gertrude, he hath found

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The head and source of all your son's distemper.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: I doubt it is no other but the main;

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: His father's death, and our o'erhasty marriage.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Well, we shall sift him.
Re-enter POLONIUS, with VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Welcome, my good friends!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Say, Voltimand, what from our brother Norway?

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Most fair return of greetings and desires.

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Upon our first, he sent out to suppress

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: His nephew's levies; which to him appear'd

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: To be a preparation 'gainst the Polack;

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: But, better look'd into, he truly found

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: It was against your highness: whereat grieved,

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: That so his sickness, age and impotence

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Was falsely borne in hand, sends out arrests

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: On Fortinbras; which he, in brief, obeys;

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Receives rebuke from Norway, and in fine

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Makes vow before his uncle never more

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: To give the assay of arms against your majesty.

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Whereon old Norway, overcome with joy,

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Gives him three thousand crowns in annual fee,

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: And his commission to employ those soldiers,

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: So levied as before, against the Polack:

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: With an entreaty, herein further shown,
Giving a paper

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: That it might please you to give quiet pass

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: Through your dominions for this enterprise,

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: On such regards of safety and allowance

sceneText.speaker: VOLTIMAND
sceneText.text: As therein are set down.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: It likes us well;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And at our more consider'd time well read,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Answer, and think upon this business.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Meantime we thank you for your well-took labour:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Go to your rest; at night we'll feast together:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Most welcome home!
Exeunt VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: This business is well ended.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: My liege, and madam, to expostulate

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What majesty should be, what duty is,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Why day is day, night night, and time is time,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Were nothing but to waste night, day and time.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Therefore, since brevity is the soul of wit,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And tediousness the limbs and outward flourishes,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I will be brief: your noble son is mad:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Mad call I it; for, to define true madness,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What is't but to be nothing else but mad?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But let that go.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: More matter, with less art.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Madam, I swear I use no art at all.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That he is mad, 'tis true: 'tis true 'tis pity;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And pity 'tis 'tis true: a foolish figure;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But farewell it, for I will use no art.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Mad let us grant him, then: and now remains

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That we find out the cause of this effect,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Or rather say, the cause of this defect,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: For this effect defective comes by cause:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Thus it remains, and the remainder thus. Perpend.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I have a daughter--have while she is mine--

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Who, in her duty and obedience, mark,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Hath given me this: now gather, and surmise.
Reads

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'To the celestial and my soul's idol, the most

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: beautified Ophelia,'--

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That's an ill phrase, a vile phrase; 'beautified' is

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: a vile phrase: but you shall hear. Thus:
Reads

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'In her excellent white bosom, these, & c.'

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Came this from Hamlet to her?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Good madam, stay awhile; I will be faithful.
Reads

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'Doubt thou the stars are fire;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Doubt that the sun doth move;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Doubt truth to be a liar;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But never doubt I love.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'O dear Ophelia, I am ill at these numbers;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I have not art to reckon my groans: but that

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I love thee best, O most best, believe it. Adieu.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'Thine evermore most dear lady, whilst

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: this machine is to him, HAMLET.'

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: This, in obedience, hath my daughter shown me,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And more above, hath his solicitings,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As they fell out by time, by means and place,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: All given to mine ear.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: But how hath she

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Received his love?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What do you think of me?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: As of a man faithful and honourable.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I would fain prove so. But what might you think,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: When I had seen this hot love on the wing--

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: As I perceived it, I must tell you that,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Before my daughter told me--what might you,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Or my dear majesty your queen here, think,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: If I had play'd the desk or table-book,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Or given my heart a winking, mute and dumb,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Or look'd upon this love with idle sight;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What might you think? No, I went round to work,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And my young mistress thus I did bespeak:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'Lord Hamlet is a prince, out of thy star;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: This must not be:' and then I precepts gave her,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That she should lock herself from his resort,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Admit no messengers, receive no tokens.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Which done, she took the fruits of my advice;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And he, repulsed--a short tale to make--

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Fell into a sadness, then into a fast,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Thence to a watch, thence into a weakness,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Thence to a lightness, and, by this declension,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Into the madness wherein now he raves,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And all we mourn for.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Do you think 'tis this?

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: It may be, very likely.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Hath there been such a time--I'd fain know that--

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That I have positively said 'Tis so,'

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: When it proved otherwise?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Not that I know.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: [Pointing to his head and shoulder]

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Take this from this, if this be otherwise:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: If circumstances lead me, I will find

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Where truth is hid, though it were hid indeed

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Within the centre.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: How may we try it further?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You know, sometimes he walks four hours together

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Here in the lobby.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: So he does indeed.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: At such a time I'll loose my daughter to him:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Be you and I behind an arras then;

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Mark the encounter: if he love her not

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And be not from his reason fall'n thereon,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Let me be no assistant for a state,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: But keep a farm and carters.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: We will try it.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: But, look, where sadly the poor wretch comes reading.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Away, I do beseech you, both away:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I'll board him presently.
Exeunt KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, and Attendants
Enter HAMLET, reading

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: O, give me leave:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: How does my good Lord Hamlet?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Well, God-a-mercy.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Do you know me, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Excellent well; you are a fishmonger.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Not I, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then I would you were so honest a man.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Honest, my lord!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, sir; to be honest, as this world goes, is to be

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: one man picked out of ten thousand.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That's very true, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For if the sun breed maggots in a dead dog, being a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: god kissing carrion,--Have you a daughter?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I have, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let her not walk i' the sun: conception is a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: blessing: but not as your daughter may conceive.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Friend, look to 't.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: [Aside] How say you by that? Still harping on my

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: daughter: yet he knew me not at first; he said I

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: was a fishmonger: he is far gone, far gone: and

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: truly in my youth I suffered much extremity for

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: love; very near this. I'll speak to him again.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What do you read, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Words, words, words.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: What is the matter, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Between who?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I mean, the matter that you read, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Slanders, sir: for the satirical rogue says here

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: that old men have grey beards, that their faces are

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: wrinkled, their eyes purging thick amber and

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: plum-tree gum and that they have a plentiful lack of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: wit, together with most weak hams: all which, sir,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: though I most powerfully and potently believe, yet

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I hold it not honesty to have it thus set down, for

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: yourself, sir, should be old as I am, if like a crab

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: you could go backward.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: [Aside] Though this be madness, yet there is method

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: in 't. Will you walk out of the air, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Into my grave.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Indeed, that is out o' the air.
Aside

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: How pregnant sometimes his replies are! a happiness

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: that often madness hits on, which reason and sanity

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: could not so prosperously be delivered of. I will

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: leave him, and suddenly contrive the means of

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: meeting between him and my daughter.--My honourable

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: lord, I will most humbly take my leave of you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You cannot, sir, take from me any thing that I will

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: more willingly part withal: except my life, except

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: my life, except my life.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Fare you well, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: These tedious old fools!
Enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: You go to seek the Lord Hamlet; there he is.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: [To POLONIUS] God save you, sir!
Exit POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: My honoured lord!

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: My most dear lord!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My excellent good friends! How dost thou,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Guildenstern? Ah, Rosencrantz! Good lads, how do ye both?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: As the indifferent children of the earth.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Happy, in that we are not over-happy;

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: On fortune's cap we are not the very button.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nor the soles of her shoe?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Neither, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then you live about her waist, or in the middle of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: her favours?

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: 'Faith, her privates we.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: In the secret parts of fortune? O, most true; she

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: is a strumpet. What's the news?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: None, my lord, but that the world's grown honest.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then is doomsday near: but your news is not true.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let me question more in particular: what have you,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: my good friends, deserved at the hands of fortune,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: that she sends you to prison hither?

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Prison, my lord!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Denmark's a prison.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Then is the world one.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A goodly one; in which there are many confines,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: wards and dungeons, Denmark being one o' the worst.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: We think not so, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, then, 'tis none to you; for there is nothing

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: either good or bad, but thinking makes it so: to me

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: it is a prison.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Why then, your ambition makes it one; 'tis too

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: narrow for your mind.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O God, I could be bounded in a nut shell and count

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: myself a king of infinite space, were it not that I

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: have bad dreams.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Which dreams indeed are ambition, for the very

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A dream itself is but a shadow.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Truly, and I hold ambition of so airy and light a

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: quality that it is but a shadow's shadow.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then are our beggars bodies, and our monarchs and

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: outstretched heroes the beggars' shadows. Shall we

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: to the court? for, by my fay, I cannot reason.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: We'll wait upon you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No such matter: I will not sort you with the rest

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: of my servants, for, to speak to you like an honest

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: man, I am most dreadfully attended. But, in the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: beaten way of friendship, what make you at Elsinore?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: To visit you, my lord; no other occasion.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Beggar that I am, I am even poor in thanks; but I

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: thank you: and sure, dear friends, my thanks are

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: too dear a halfpenny. Were you not sent for? Is it

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: your own inclining? Is it a free visitation? Come,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: deal justly with me: come, come; nay, speak.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: What should we say, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, any thing, but to the purpose. You were sent

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: for; and there is a kind of confession in your looks

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: which your modesties have not craft enough to colour:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I know the good king and queen have sent for you.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: To what end, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That you must teach me. But let me conjure you, by

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the rights of our fellowship, by the consonancy of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: our youth, by the obligation of our ever-preserved

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: love, and by what more dear a better proposer could

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: charge you withal, be even and direct with me,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: whether you were sent for, or no?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: [Aside to GUILDENSTERN] What say you?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: [Aside] Nay, then, I have an eye of you.--If you

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: love me, hold not off.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: My lord, we were sent for.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I will tell you why; so shall my anticipation

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: prevent your discovery, and your secrecy to the king

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: and queen moult no feather. I have of late--but

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: wherefore I know not--lost all my mirth, forgone all

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: custom of exercises; and indeed it goes so heavily

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: with my disposition that this goodly frame, the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: earth, seems to me a sterile promontory, this most

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: excellent canopy, the air, look you, this brave

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: o'erhanging firmament, this majestical roof fretted

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: with golden fire, why, it appears no other thing to

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: me than a foul and pestilent congregation of vapours.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What a piece of work is a man! how noble in reason!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: how infinite in faculty! in form and moving how

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: express and admirable! in action how like an angel!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: in apprehension how like a god! the beauty of the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: world! the paragon of animals! And yet, to me,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: what is this quintessence of dust? man delights not

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: me: no, nor woman neither, though by your smiling

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: you seem to say so.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: My lord, there was no such stuff in my thoughts.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why did you laugh then, when I said 'man delights not me'?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: To think, my lord, if you delight not in man, what

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: lenten entertainment the players shall receive from

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: you: we coted them on the way; and hither are they

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: coming, to offer you service.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He that plays the king shall be welcome; his majesty

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: shall have tribute of me; the adventurous knight

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: shall use his foil and target; the lover shall not

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: sigh gratis; the humourous man shall end his part

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: in peace; the clown shall make those laugh whose

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: lungs are tickled o' the sere; and the lady shall

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: say her mind freely, or the blank verse shall halt

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: for't. What players are they?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Even those you were wont to take delight in, the

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: tragedians of the city.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET

sceneText.text: In my heart's core, ay, in my heart of heart,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As I do thee.--Something too much of this.--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: There is a play to-night before the king;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: One scene of it comes near the circumstance

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Which I have told thee of my father's death:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I prithee, when thou seest that act afoot,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Even with the very comment of thy soul

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Observe mine uncle: if his occulted guilt

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Do not itself unkennel in one speech,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It is a damned ghost that we have seen,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And my imaginations are as foul

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As Vulcan's stithy. Give him heedful note;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For I mine eyes will rivet to his face,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And after we will both our judgments join

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: In censure of his seeming.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Well, my lord:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: If he steal aught the whilst this play is playing,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And 'scape detecting, I will pay the theft.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: They are coming to the play; I must be idle:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Get you a place.
Danish march. A flourish. Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS, OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: How fares our cousin Hamlet?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Excellent, i' faith; of the chameleon's dish: I eat

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the air, promise-crammed: you cannot feed capons so.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I have nothing with this answer, Hamlet; these words

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: are not mine.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, nor mine now.
To POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My lord, you played once i' the university, you say?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: That did I, my lord; and was accounted a good actor.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What did you enact?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I did enact Julius Caesar: I was killed i' the

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Capitol; Brutus killed me.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It was a brute part of him to kill so capital a calf

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: there. Be the players ready?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Ay, my lord; they stay upon your patience.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Come hither, my dear Hamlet, sit by me.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, good mother, here's metal more attractive.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: [To KING CLAUDIUS] O, ho! do you mark that?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Lady, shall I lie in your lap?
Lying down at OPHELIA's feet

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: No, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I mean, my head upon your lap?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Ay, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Do you think I meant country matters?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: I think nothing, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That's a fair thought to lie between maids' legs.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: What is, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nothing.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: You are merry, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Who, I?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Ay, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O God, your only jig-maker. What should a man do

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: but be merry? for, look you, how cheerfully my

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: mother looks, and my father died within these two hours.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Nay, 'tis twice two months, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So long? Nay then, let the devil wear black, for

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll have a suit of sables. O heavens! die two

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: months ago, and not forgotten yet? Then there's

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: hope a great man's memory may outlive his life half

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: a year: but, by'r lady, he must build churches,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: then; or else shall he suffer not thinking on, with

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the hobby-horse, whose epitaph is 'For, O, for, O,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the hobby-horse is forgot.'
Hautboys play. The dumb-show enters

Enter a King and a Queen very lovingly; the Queen embracing him, and he her. She kneels, and makes show of protestation unto him. He takes her up, and declines his head upon her neck: lays him down upon a bank of flowers: she, seeing him asleep, leaves him. Anon comes in a fellow, takes off his crown, kisses it, and pours poison in the King's ears, and exit. The Queen returns; finds the King dead, and makes passionate action. The Poisoner, with some two or three Mutes, comes in again, seeming to lament with her. The dead body is carried away. The Poisoner wooes the Queen with gifts: she seems loath and unwilling awhile, but in the end accepts his love
Exeunt

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: What means this, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Marry, this is miching mallecho; it means mischief.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Belike this show imports the argument of the play.
Enter Prologue

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: We shall know by this fellow: the players cannot

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: keep counsel; they'll tell all.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Will he tell us what this show meant?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, or any show that you'll show him: be not you

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: ashamed to show, he'll not shame to tell you what it means.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: You are naught, you are naught: I'll mark the play.

sceneText.speaker: Prologue
sceneText.text: For us, and for our tragedy,

sceneText.speaker: Prologue
sceneText.text: Here stooping to your clemency,

sceneText.speaker: Prologue
sceneText.text: We beg your hearing patiently.
Exit

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Is this a prologue, or the posy of a ring?

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: 'Tis brief, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As woman's love.
Enter two Players, King and Queen

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Full thirty times hath Phoebus' cart gone round

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Neptune's salt wash and Tellus' orbed ground,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: And thirty dozen moons with borrow'd sheen

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: About the world have times twelve thirties been,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Since love our hearts and Hymen did our hands

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Unite commutual in most sacred bands.

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: So many journeys may the sun and moon

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Make us again count o'er ere love be done!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: But, woe is me, you are so sick of late,

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: So far from cheer and from your former state,

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: That I distrust you. Yet, though I distrust,

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Discomfort you, my lord, it nothing must:

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: For women's fear and love holds quantity;

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: In neither aught, or in extremity.

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Now, what my love is, proof hath made you know;

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: And as my love is sized, my fear is so:

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Where love is great, the littlest doubts are fear;

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Where little fears grow great, great love grows there.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: 'Faith, I must leave thee, love, and shortly too;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: My operant powers their functions leave to do:

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: And thou shalt live in this fair world behind,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Honour'd, beloved; and haply one as kind

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: For husband shalt thou--

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: O, confound the rest!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Such love must needs be treason in my breast:

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: In second husband let me be accurst!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: None wed the second but who kill'd the first.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: [Aside] Wormwood, wormwood.

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: The instances that second marriage move

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Are base respects of thrift, but none of love:

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: A second time I kill my husband dead,

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: When second husband kisses me in bed.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: I do believe you think what now you speak;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: But what we do determine oft we break.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Purpose is but the slave to memory,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Of violent birth, but poor validity;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Which now, like fruit unripe, sticks on the tree;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: But fall, unshaken, when they mellow be.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Most necessary 'tis that we forget

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: To pay ourselves what to ourselves is debt:

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: What to ourselves in passion we propose,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: The passion ending, doth the purpose lose.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: The violence of either grief or joy

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Their own enactures with themselves destroy:

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Where joy most revels, grief doth most lament;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Grief joys, joy grieves, on slender accident.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: This world is not for aye, nor 'tis not strange

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: That even our loves should with our fortunes change;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: For 'tis a question left us yet to prove,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Whether love lead fortune, or else fortune love.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: The great man down, you mark his favourite flies;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: The poor advanced makes friends of enemies.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: And hitherto doth love on fortune tend;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: For who not needs shall never lack a friend,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: And who in want a hollow friend doth try,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Directly seasons him his enemy.

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: But, orderly to end where I begun,

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Our wills and fates do so contrary run

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: That our devices still are overthrown;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: Our thoughts are ours, their ends none of our own:

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: So think thou wilt no second husband wed;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: But die thy thoughts when thy first lord is dead.

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Nor earth to me give food, nor heaven light!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Sport and repose lock from me day and night!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: To desperation turn my trust and hope!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: An anchor's cheer in prison be my scope!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Each opposite that blanks the face of joy

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Meet what I would have well and it destroy!

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Both here and hence pursue me lasting strife,

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: If, once a widow, ever I be wife!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If she should break it now!

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: 'Tis deeply sworn. Sweet, leave me here awhile;

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: My spirits grow dull, and fain I would beguile

sceneText.speaker: Player King
sceneText.text: The tedious day with sleep.
Sleeps

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: Sleep rock thy brain,

sceneText.speaker: Player Queen
sceneText.text: And never come mischance between us twain!
Exit

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Madam, how like you this play?

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: The lady protests too much, methinks.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, but she'll keep her word.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Have you heard the argument? Is there no offence in 't?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, no, they do but jest, poison in jest; no offence

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: i' the world.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: What do you call the play?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The Mouse-trap. Marry, how? Tropically. This play

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: is the image of a murder done in Vienna: Gonzago is

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the duke's name; his wife, Baptista: you shall see

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: anon; 'tis a knavish piece of work: but what o'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: that? your majesty and we that have free souls, it

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: touches us not: let the galled jade wince, our

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: withers are unwrung.
Enter LUCIANUS

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This is one Lucianus, nephew to the king.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: You are as good as a chorus, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I could interpret between you and your love, if I

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: could see the puppets dallying.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: You are keen, my lord, you are keen.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It would cost you a groaning to take off my edge.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: Still better, and worse.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So you must take your husbands. Begin, murderer;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: pox, leave thy damnable faces, and begin. Come:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'the croaking raven doth bellow for revenge.'

sceneText.speaker: LUCIANUS
sceneText.text: Thoughts black, hands apt, drugs fit, and time agreeing;

sceneText.speaker: LUCIANUS
sceneText.text: Confederate season, else no creature seeing;

sceneText.speaker: LUCIANUS
sceneText.text: Thou mixture rank, of midnight weeds collected,

sceneText.speaker: LUCIANUS
sceneText.text: With Hecate's ban thrice blasted, thrice infected,

sceneText.speaker: LUCIANUS
sceneText.text: Thy natural magic and dire property,

sceneText.speaker: LUCIANUS
sceneText.text: On wholesome life usurp immediately.
Pours the poison into the sleeper's ears

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He poisons him i' the garden for's estate. His

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: name's Gonzago: the story is extant, and writ in

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: choice Italian: you shall see anon how the murderer

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: gets the love of Gonzago's wife.

sceneText.speaker: OPHELIA
sceneText.text: The king rises.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What, frighted with false fire!

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: How fares my lord?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Give o'er the play.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Give me some light: away!

sceneText.speaker: All
sceneText.text: Lights, lights, lights!
Exeunt all but HAMLET and HORATIO

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, let the stricken deer go weep,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The hart ungalled play;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For some must watch, while some must sleep:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So runs the world away.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Would not this, sir, and a forest of feathers-- if

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the rest of my fortunes turn Turk with me--with two

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Provincial roses on my razed shoes, get me a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: fellowship in a cry of players, sir?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Half a share.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A whole one, I.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For thou dost know, O Damon dear,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This realm dismantled was

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Of Jove himself; and now reigns here

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A very, very--pajock.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: You might have rhymed.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O good Horatio, I'll take the ghost's word for a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: thousand pound. Didst perceive?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Very well, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Upon the talk of the poisoning?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I did very well note him.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ah, ha! Come, some music! come, the recorders!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For if the king like not the comedy,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why then, belike, he likes it not, perdy.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Come, some music!
Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Good my lord, vouchsafe me a word with you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, a whole history.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: The king, sir,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, sir, what of him?

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Is in his retirement marvellous distempered.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With drink, sir?

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: No, my lord, rather with choler.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Your wisdom should show itself more richer to

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: signify this to his doctor; for, for me to put him

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: to his purgation would perhaps plunge him into far

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: more choler.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Good my lord, put your discourse into some frame and

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: start not so wildly from my affair.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I am tame, sir: pronounce.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: The queen, your mother, in most great affliction of

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: spirit, hath sent me to you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You are welcome.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Nay, good my lord, this courtesy is not of the right

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: breed. If it shall please you to make me a

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: wholesome answer, I will do your mother's

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: commandment: if not, your pardon and my return

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: shall be the end of my business.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, I cannot.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: What, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Make you a wholesome answer; my wit's diseased: but,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: sir, such answer as I can make, you shall command;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: or, rather, as you say, my mother: therefore no

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: more, but to the matter: my mother, you say,--

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Then thus she says; your behavior hath struck her

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: into amazement and admiration.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother! But

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: is there no sequel at the heels of this mother's

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: admiration? Impart.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: She desires to speak with you in her closet, ere you

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: go to bed.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: We shall obey, were she ten times our mother. Have

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: you any further trade with us?

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: My lord, you once did love me.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So I do still, by these pickers and stealers.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Good my lord, what is your cause of distemper? you

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: do, surely, bar the door upon your own liberty, if

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: you deny your griefs to your friend.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, I lack advancement.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: How can that be, when you have the voice of the king

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: himself for your succession in Denmark?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, but sir, 'While the grass grows,'--the proverb

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: is something musty.
Re-enter Players with recorders

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, the recorders! let me see one. To withdraw with

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: you:--why do you go about to recover the wind of me,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: as if you would drive me into a toil?

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: O, my lord, if my duty be too bold, my love is too

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: unmannerly.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I do not well understand that. Will you play upon

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: this pipe?

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: My lord, I cannot.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I pray you.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Believe me, I cannot.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I do beseech you.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: I know no touch of it, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Tis as easy as lying: govern these ventages with

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: your lingers and thumb, give it breath with your

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: mouth, and it will discourse most eloquent music.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Look you, these are the stops.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: But these cannot I command to any utterance of

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: harmony; I have not the skill.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, look you now, how unworthy a thing you make of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: me! You would play upon me; you would seem to know

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: my stops; you would pluck out the heart of my

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: mystery; you would sound me from my lowest note to

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the top of my compass: and there is much music,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: excellent voice, in this little organ; yet cannot

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: you make it speak. 'Sblood, do you think I am

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: easier to be played on than a pipe? Call me what

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: instrument you will, though you can fret me, yet you

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: cannot play upon me.
Enter POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: God bless you, sir!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: My lord, the queen would speak with you, and

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: presently.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Do you see yonder cloud that's almost in shape of a camel?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: By the mass, and 'tis like a camel, indeed.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Methinks it is like a weasel.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: It is backed like a weasel.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or like a whale?

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Very like a whale.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I will say so.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: By and by is easily said.
Exit POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Leave me, friends.
Exeunt all but HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Tis now the very witching time of night,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And do such bitter business as the day

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O heart, lose not thy nature; let not ever

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let me be cruel, not unnatural:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I will speak daggers to her, but use none;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How in my words soever she be shent,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To give them seals never, my soul, consent!
Exit

scenes.text: SCENE III. A room in the castle.

sceneText.text: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I like him not, nor stands it safe with us

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I your commission will forthwith dispatch,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And he to England shall along with you:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The terms of our estate may not endure

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Out of his lunacies.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: We will ourselves provide:

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: Most holy and religious fear it is

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: To keep those many many bodies safe

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: That live and feed upon your majesty.

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: The single and peculiar life is bound,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: With all the strength and armour of the mind,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: To keep itself from noyance; but much more

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: The lives of many. The cease of majesty

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Dies not alone; but, like a gulf, doth draw

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: What's near it with it: it is a massy wheel,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Fix'd on the summit of the highest mount,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: To whose huge spokes ten thousand lesser things

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Are mortised and adjoin'd; which, when it falls,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Each small annexment, petty consequence,

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Attends the boisterous ruin. Never alone

sceneText.speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
sceneText.text: Did the king sigh, but with a general groan.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: For we will fetters put upon this fear,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Which now goes too free-footed.

sceneText.speaker: GUILDENSTERN
sceneText.text: We will haste us.
Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN
Enter POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: My lord, he's going to his mother's closet:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Behind the arras I'll convey myself,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: To hear the process; and warrant she'll tax him home:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And, as you said, and wisely was it said,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: 'Tis meet that some more audience than a mother,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Since nature makes them partial, should o'erhear

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: The speech, of vantage. Fare you well, my liege:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: I'll call upon you ere you go to bed,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And tell you what I know.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Thanks, dear my lord.
Exit POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: It hath the primal eldest curse upon't,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: A brother's murder. Pray can I not,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Though inclination be as sharp as will:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And, like a man to double business bound,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I stand in pause where I shall first begin,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And both neglect. What if this cursed hand

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Were thicker than itself with brother's blood,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: But to confront the visage of offence?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And what's in prayer but this two-fold force,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To be forestalled ere we come to fall,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Or pardon'd being down? Then I'll look up;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Can serve my turn? 'Forgive me my foul murder'?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: That cannot be; since I am still possess'd

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Of those effects for which I did the murder,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: May one be pardon'd and retain the offence?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In the corrupted currents of this world

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Offence's gilded hand may shove by justice,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And oft 'tis seen the wicked prize itself

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Buys out the law: but 'tis not so above;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: There is no shuffling, there the action lies

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In his true nature; and we ourselves compell'd,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: To give in evidence. What then? what rests?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Try what repentance can: what can it not?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Yet what can it when one can not repent?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: O wretched state! O bosom black as death!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Bow, stubborn knees; and, heart with strings of steel,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: All may be well.
Retires and kneels
Enter HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Now might I do it pat, now he is praying;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And now I'll do't. And so he goes to heaven;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And so am I revenged. That would be scann'd:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A villain kills my father; and for that,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I, his sole son, do this same villain send

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To heaven.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, this is hire and salary, not revenge.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He took my father grossly, full of bread;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And how his audit stands who knows save heaven?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But in our circumstance and course of thought,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Tis heavy with him: and am I then revenged,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To take him in the purging of his soul,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: When he is fit and season'd for his passage?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Up, sword; and know thou a more horrid hent:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: When he is drunk asleep, or in his rage,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: At gaming, swearing, or about some act

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That has no relish of salvation in't;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And that his soul may be as damn'd and black

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As hell, whereto it goes. My mother stays:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This physic but prolongs thy sickly days.
Exit

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: [Rising] My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Words without thoughts never to heaven go.
Exit

scenes.text: SCENE IV. The Queen's closet.

sceneText.text: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE and POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: He will come straight. Look you lay home to him:

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Tell him his pranks have been too broad to bear with,

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: And that your grace hath screen'd and stood between

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Much heat and him. I'll sconce me even here.

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: Pray you, be round with him.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: [Within] Mother, mother, mother!

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: I'll warrant you,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Fear me not: withdraw, I hear him coming.
POLONIUS hides behind the arras
Enter HAMLET

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Now, mother, what's the matter?

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Hamlet, thou hast thy father much offended.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Mother, you have my father much offended.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Come, come, you answer with an idle tongue.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Why, how now, Hamlet!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What's the matter now?

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Have you forgot me?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, by the rood, not so:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You are the queen, your husband's brother's wife;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And--would it were not so!--you are my mother.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Nay, then, I'll set those to you that can speak.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Come, come, and sit you down; you shall not budge;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You go not till I set you up a glass

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Where you may see the inmost part of you.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: What wilt thou do? thou wilt not murder me?

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Help, help, ho!

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: [Behind] What, ho! help, help, help!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: [Drawing] How now! a rat? Dead, for a ducat, dead!
Makes a pass through the arras

sceneText.speaker: LORD POLONIUS
sceneText.text: [Behind] O, I am slain!
Falls and dies

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: O me, what hast thou done?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nay, I know not:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Is it the king?

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: O, what a rash and bloody deed is this!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A bloody deed! almost as bad, good mother,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As kill a king, and marry with his brother.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: As kill a king!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, lady, 'twas my word.
Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewell!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I took thee for thy better: take thy fortune;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thou find'st to be too busy is some danger.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Leave wringing of your hands: peace! sit you down,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And let me wring your heart; for so I shall,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If it be made of penetrable stuff,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If damned custom have not brass'd it so

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That it is proof and bulwark against sense.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: What have I done, that thou darest wag thy tongue
