sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Scripture? The Scripture says 'Adam digged:'

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: could he dig without arms? I'll put another

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: question to thee: if thou answerest me not to the

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: purpose, confess thyself--

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: Go to.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: What is he that builds stronger than either the

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: mason, the shipwright, or the carpenter?

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: The gallows-maker; for that frame outlives a

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: thousand tenants.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: I like thy wit well, in good faith: the gallows

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: does well; but how does it well? it does well to

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: those that do in: now thou dost ill to say the

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: gallows is built stronger than the church: argal,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: the gallows may do well to thee. To't again, come.

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: 'Who builds stronger than a mason, a shipwright, or

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: a carpenter?'

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Ay, tell me that, and unyoke.

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: Marry, now I can tell.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: To't.

sceneText.speaker: Second Clown
sceneText.text: Mass, I cannot tell.
Enter HAMLET and HORATIO, at a distance

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Cudgel thy brains no more about it, for your dull

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: ass will not mend his pace with beating; and, when

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: you are asked this question next, say 'a

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: grave-maker: 'the houses that he makes last till

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: doomsday. Go, get thee to Yaughan: fetch me a

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: stoup of liquor.
Exit Second Clown
He digs and sings

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: In youth, when I did love, did love,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Methought it was very sweet,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: To contract, O, the time, for, ah, my behove,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: O, methought, there was nothing meet.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Has this fellow no feeling of his business, that he

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: sings at grave-making?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Custom hath made it in him a property of easiness.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Tis e'en so: the hand of little employment hath

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the daintier sense.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: [Sings]

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: But age, with his stealing steps,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Hath claw'd me in his clutch,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: And hath shipped me intil the land,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: As if I had never been such.
Throws up a skull

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That skull had a tongue in it, and could sing once:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: how the knave jowls it to the ground, as if it were

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Cain's jaw-bone, that did the first murder! It

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: might be the pate of a politician, which this ass

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: now o'er-reaches; one that would circumvent God,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: might it not?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It might, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Or of a courtier; which could say 'Good morrow,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: sweet lord! How dost thou, good lord?' This might

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: be my lord such-a-one, that praised my lord

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: such-a-one's horse, when he meant to beg it; might it not?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Ay, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, e'en so: and now my Lady Worm's; chapless, and

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: knocked about the mazzard with a sexton's spade:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: here's fine revolution, an we had the trick to

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: see't. Did these bones cost no more the breeding,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: but to play at loggats with 'em? mine ache to think on't.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: [Sings]

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: A pick-axe, and a spade, a spade,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: For and a shrouding sheet:

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: O, a pit of clay for to be made

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: For such a guest is meet.
Throws up another skull

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: There's another: why may not that be the skull of a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: lawyer? Where be his quiddities now, his quillets,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: his cases, his tenures, and his tricks? why does he

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: suffer this rude knave now to knock him about the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: sconce with a dirty shovel, and will not tell him of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: his action of battery? Hum! This fellow might be

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: in's time a great buyer of land, with his statutes,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: his recognizances, his fines, his double vouchers,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: his recoveries: is this the fine of his fines, and

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the recovery of his recoveries, to have his fine

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: pate full of fine dirt? will his vouchers vouch him

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: no more of his purchases, and double ones too, than

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the length and breadth of a pair of indentures? The

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: very conveyances of his lands will hardly lie in

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: this box; and must the inheritor himself have no more, ha?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Not a jot more, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Is not parchment made of sheepskins?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Ay, my lord, and of calf-skins too.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: They are sheep and calves which seek out assurance

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: in that. I will speak to this fellow. Whose

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: grave's this, sirrah?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Mine, sir.
Sings

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: O, a pit of clay for to be made

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: For such a guest is meet.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I think it be thine, indeed; for thou liest in't.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: You lie out on't, sir, and therefore it is not

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: yours: for my part, I do not lie in't, and yet it is mine.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Thou dost lie in't, to be in't and say it is thine:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'tis for the dead, not for the quick; therefore thou liest.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: 'Tis a quick lie, sir; 'twill away gain, from me to

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What man dost thou dig it for?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: For no man, sir.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What woman, then?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: For none, neither.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Who is to be buried in't?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: One that was a woman, sir; but, rest her soul, she's dead.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How absolute the knave is! we must speak by the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: card, or equivocation will undo us. By the Lord,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Horatio, these three years I have taken a note of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: it; the age is grown so picked that the toe of the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: peasant comes so near the heel of the courtier, he

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: gaffs his kibe. How long hast thou been a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: grave-maker?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Of all the days i' the year, I came to't that day

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: that our last king Hamlet overcame Fortinbras.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How long is that since?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Cannot you tell that? every fool can tell that: it

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: was the very day that young Hamlet was born; he that

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: is mad, and sent into England.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ay, marry, why was he sent into England?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Why, because he was mad: he shall recover his wits

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: there; or, if he do not, it's no great matter there.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: 'Twill, a not be seen in him there; there the men

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: are as mad as he.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How came he mad?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Very strangely, they say.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How strangely?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Faith, e'en with losing his wits.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Upon what ground?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Why, here in Denmark: I have been sexton here, man

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: and boy, thirty years.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How long will a man lie i' the earth ere he rot?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: I' faith, if he be not rotten before he die--as we

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: have many pocky corses now-a-days, that will scarce

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: hold the laying in--he will last you some eight year

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: or nine year: a tanner will last you nine year.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why he more than another?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Why, sir, his hide is so tanned with his trade, that

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: he will keep out water a great while; and your water

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: is a sore decayer of your whoreson dead body.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: Here's a skull now; this skull has lain in the earth

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: three and twenty years.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Whose was it?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: A whoreson mad fellow's it was: whose do you think it was?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nay, I know not.

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: A pestilence on him for a mad rogue! a' poured a

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: flagon of Rhenish on my head once. This same skull,

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: sir, was Yorick's skull, the king's jester.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This?

sceneText.speaker: First Clown
sceneText.text: E'en that.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let me see.
Takes the skull

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio: a fellow

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy: he hath

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: borne me on his back a thousand times; and now, how

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: abhorred in my imagination it is! my gorge rims at

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: it. Here hung those lips that I have kissed I know

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: not how oft. Where be your gibes now? your

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: gambols? your songs? your flashes of merriment,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: that were wont to set the table on a roar? Not one

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: now, to mock your own grinning? quite chap-fallen?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Now get you to my lady's chamber, and tell her, let

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: her paint an inch thick, to this favour she must

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: come; make her laugh at that. Prithee, Horatio, tell

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: me one thing.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What's that, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Dost thou think Alexander looked o' this fashion i'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the earth?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: E'en so.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And smelt so? pah!
Puts down the skull

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: E'en so, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To what base uses we may return, Horatio! Why may

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: not imagination trace the noble dust of Alexander,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: till he find it stopping a bung-hole?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: 'Twere to consider too curiously, to consider so.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, faith, not a jot; but to follow him thither with

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: modesty enough, and likelihood to lead it: as

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: thus: Alexander died, Alexander was buried,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Alexander returneth into dust; the dust is earth; of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: earth we make loam; and why of that loam, whereto he

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: was converted, might they not stop a beer-barrel?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Imperious Caesar, dead and turn'd to clay,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Might stop a hole to keep the wind away:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, that that earth, which kept the world in awe,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Should patch a wall to expel the winter flaw!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But soft! but soft! aside: here comes the king.
Enter Priest, & c. in procession; the Corpse of OPHELIA, LAERTES and Mourners following; KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, their trains, & c

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The queen, the courtiers: who is this they follow?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And with such maimed rites? This doth betoken

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The corse they follow did with desperate hand

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Fordo its own life: 'twas of some estate.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Couch we awhile, and mark.
Retiring with HORATIO

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: What ceremony else?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That is Laertes,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A very noble youth: mark.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: What ceremony else?

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: Her obsequies have been as far enlarged

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: As we have warrantise: her death was doubtful;

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: And, but that great command o'ersways the order,

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: She should in ground unsanctified have lodged

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: Till the last trumpet: for charitable prayers,

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: Shards, flints and pebbles should be thrown on her;

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: Yet here she is allow'd her virgin crants,

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: Her maiden strewments and the bringing home

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: Of bell and burial.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Must there no more be done?

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: No more be done:

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: We should profane the service of the dead

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: To sing a requiem and such rest to her

sceneText.speaker: First Priest
sceneText.text: As to peace-parted souls.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Lay her i' the earth:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And from her fair and unpolluted flesh

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: May violets spring! I tell thee, churlish priest,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: A ministering angel shall my sister be,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: When thou liest howling.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What, the fair Ophelia!

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Sweets to the sweet: farewell!
Scattering flowers

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: I hoped thou shouldst have been my Hamlet's wife;

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: I thought thy bride-bed to have deck'd, sweet maid,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: And not have strew'd thy grave.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: O, treble woe

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Fall ten times treble on that cursed head,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Whose wicked deed thy most ingenious sense

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Deprived thee of! Hold off the earth awhile,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Till I have caught her once more in mine arms:
Leaps into the grave

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Now pile your dust upon the quick and dead,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Till of this flat a mountain you have made,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: To o'ertop old Pelion, or the skyish head

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Of blue Olympus.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: [Advancing] What is he whose grief

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Bears such an emphasis? whose phrase of sorrow

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Conjures the wandering stars, and makes them stand

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Like wonder-wounded hearers? This is I,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hamlet the Dane.
Leaps into the grave

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The devil take thy soul!
Grappling with him

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thou pray'st not well.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I prithee, take thy fingers from my throat;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For, though I am not splenitive and rash,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Yet have I something in me dangerous,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Which let thy wiseness fear: hold off thy hand.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Pluck them asunder.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Hamlet, Hamlet!

sceneText.speaker: All
sceneText.text: Gentlemen,--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Good my lord, be quiet.
The Attendants part them, and they come out of the grave

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why I will fight with him upon this theme

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Until my eyelids will no longer wag.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: O my son, what theme?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I loved Ophelia: forty thousand brothers

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Could not, with all their quantity of love,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Make up my sum. What wilt thou do for her?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: O, he is mad, Laertes.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: For love of God, forbear him.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Swounds, show me what thou'lt do:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Woo't weep? woo't fight? woo't fast? woo't tear thyself?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Woo't drink up eisel? eat a crocodile?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll do't. Dost thou come here to whine?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To outface me with leaping in her grave?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Be buried quick with her, and so will I:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And, if thou prate of mountains, let them throw

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Millions of acres on us, till our ground,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Singeing his pate against the burning zone,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Make Ossa like a wart! Nay, an thou'lt mouth,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll rant as well as thou.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: This is mere madness:

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: And thus awhile the fit will work on him;

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Anon, as patient as the female dove,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: When that her golden couplets are disclosed,

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: His silence will sit drooping.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hear you, sir;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What is the reason that you use me thus?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I loved you ever: but it is no matter;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let Hercules himself do what he may,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The cat will mew and dog will have his day.
Exit

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I pray you, good Horatio, wait upon him.
Exit HORATIO
To LAERTES

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Strengthen your patience in our last night's speech;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: We'll put the matter to the present push.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Good Gertrude, set some watch over your son.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: This grave shall have a living monument:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: An hour of quiet shortly shall we see;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Till then, in patience our proceeding be.
Exeunt

scenes.text: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.

sceneText.text: Enter HAMLET and HORATIO

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So much for this, sir: now shall you see the other;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You do remember all the circumstance?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Remember it, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, in my heart there was a kind of fighting,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That would not let me sleep: methought I lay

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Worse than the mutines in the bilboes. Rashly,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And praised be rashness for it, let us know,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Our indiscretion sometimes serves us well,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: When our deep plots do pall: and that should teach us

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: There's a divinity that shapes our ends,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Rough-hew them how we will,--

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: That is most certain.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Up from my cabin,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My sea-gown scarf'd about me, in the dark

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Groped I to find out them; had my desire.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Finger'd their packet, and in fine withdrew

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To mine own room again; making so bold,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My fears forgetting manners, to unseal

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Their grand commission; where I found, Horatio,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O royal knavery!--an exact command,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Larded with many several sorts of reasons

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Importing Denmark's health and England's too,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With, ho! such bugs and goblins in my life,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That, on the supervise, no leisure bated,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, not to stay the grinding of the axe,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: My head should be struck off.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Is't possible?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Here's the commission: read it at more leisure.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But wilt thou hear me how I did proceed?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I beseech you.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Being thus be-netted round with villanies,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Ere I could make a prologue to my brains,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: They had begun the play--I sat me down,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Devised a new commission, wrote it fair:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I once did hold it, as our statists do,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: A baseness to write fair and labour'd much

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How to forget that learning, but, sir, now

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It did me yeoman's service: wilt thou know

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The effect of what I wrote?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Ay, good my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: An earnest conjuration from the king,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As England was his faithful tributary,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As love between them like the palm might flourish,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As peace should stiff her wheaten garland wear

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And stand a comma 'tween their amities,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And many such-like 'As'es of great charge,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That, on the view and knowing of these contents,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Without debatement further, more or less,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He should the bearers put to sudden death,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Not shriving-time allow'd.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: How was this seal'd?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, even in that was heaven ordinant.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I had my father's signet in my purse,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Which was the model of that Danish seal;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Folded the writ up in form of the other,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Subscribed it, gave't the impression, placed it safely,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The changeling never known. Now, the next day

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Was our sea-fight; and what to this was sequent

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thou know'st already.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: So Guildenstern and Rosencrantz go to't.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Why, man, they did make love to this employment;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: They are not near my conscience; their defeat

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Does by their own insinuation grow:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'Tis dangerous when the baser nature comes

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Between the pass and fell incensed points

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Of mighty opposites.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Why, what a king is this!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Does it not, think'st thee, stand me now upon--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He that hath kill'd my king and whored my mother,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Popp'd in between the election and my hopes,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thrown out his angle for my proper life,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And with such cozenage--is't not perfect conscience,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To quit him with this arm? and is't not to be damn'd,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To let this canker of our nature come

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: In further evil?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: It must be shortly known to him from England

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What is the issue of the business there.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It will be short: the interim is mine;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And a man's life's no more than to say 'One.'

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But I am very sorry, good Horatio,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That to Laertes I forgot myself;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: For, by the image of my cause, I see

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The portraiture of his: I'll court his favours.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But, sure, the bravery of his grief did put me

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Into a towering passion.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Peace! who comes here?
Enter OSRIC

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Your lordship is right welcome back to Denmark.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I humbly thank you, sir. Dost know this water-fly?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: No, my good lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thy state is the more gracious; for 'tis a vice to

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: know him. He hath much land, and fertile: let a

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: beast be lord of beasts, and his crib shall stand at

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the king's mess: 'tis a chough; but, as I say,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: spacious in the possession of dirt.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Sweet lord, if your lordship were at leisure, I

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: should impart a thing to you from his majesty.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I will receive it, sir, with all diligence of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: spirit. Put your bonnet to his right use; 'tis for the head.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: I thank your lordship, it is very hot.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, believe me, 'tis very cold; the wind is

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: northerly.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: It is indifferent cold, my lord, indeed.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But yet methinks it is very sultry and hot for my

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: complexion.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Exceedingly, my lord; it is very sultry,--as

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: 'twere,--I cannot tell how. But, my lord, his

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: majesty bade me signify to you that he has laid a

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: great wager on your head: sir, this is the matter,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I beseech you, remember--
HAMLET moves him to put on his hat

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Nay, good my lord; for mine ease, in good faith.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Sir, here is newly come to court Laertes; believe

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: me, an absolute gentleman, full of most excellent

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: differences, of very soft society and great showing:

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: indeed, to speak feelingly of him, he is the card or

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: calendar of gentry, for you shall find in him the

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: continent of what part a gentleman would see.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, his definement suffers no perdition in you;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: though, I know, to divide him inventorially would

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: dizzy the arithmetic of memory, and yet but yaw

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: neither, in respect of his quick sail. But, in the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: verity of extolment, I take him to be a soul of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: great article; and his infusion of such dearth and

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: rareness, as, to make true diction of him, his

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: semblable is his mirror; and who else would trace

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: him, his umbrage, nothing more.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Your lordship speaks most infallibly of him.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The concernancy, sir? why do we wrap the gentleman

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: in our more rawer breath?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Sir?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Is't not possible to understand in another tongue?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: You will do't, sir, really.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What imports the nomination of this gentleman?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Of Laertes?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: His purse is empty already; all's golden words are spent.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Of him, sir.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: I know you are not ignorant--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I would you did, sir; yet, in faith, if you did,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: it would not much approve me. Well, sir?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: You are not ignorant of what excellence Laertes is--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I dare not confess that, lest I should compare with

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: him in excellence; but, to know a man well, were to

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: know himself.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: I mean, sir, for his weapon; but in the imputation

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: laid on him by them, in his meed he's unfellowed.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What's his weapon?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Rapier and dagger.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That's two of his weapons: but, well.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: The king, sir, hath wagered with him six Barbary

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: horses: against the which he has imponed, as I take

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: it, six French rapiers and poniards, with their

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: assigns, as girdle, hangers, and so: three of the

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: carriages, in faith, are very dear to fancy, very

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: responsive to the hilts, most delicate carriages,

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: and of very liberal conceit.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What call you the carriages?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I knew you must be edified by the margent ere you had done.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: The carriages, sir, are the hangers.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The phrase would be more german to the matter, if we

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: could carry cannon by our sides: I would it might

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: be hangers till then. But, on: six Barbary horses

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: against six French swords, their assigns, and three

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: liberal-conceited carriages; that's the French bet

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: against the Danish. Why is this 'imponed,' as you call it?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: The king, sir, hath laid, that in a dozen passes

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: between yourself and him, he shall not exceed you

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: three hits: he hath laid on twelve for nine; and it

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: would come to immediate trial, if your lordship

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: would vouchsafe the answer.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How if I answer 'no'?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: I mean, my lord, the opposition of your person in trial.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, I will walk here in the hall: if it please his

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: majesty, 'tis the breathing time of day with me; let

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the foils be brought, the gentleman willing, and the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: king hold his purpose, I will win for him an I can;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: if not, I will gain nothing but my shame and the odd hits.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Shall I re-deliver you e'en so?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To this effect, sir; after what flourish your nature will.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: I commend my duty to your lordship.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Yours, yours.
Exit OSRIC

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He does well to commend it himself; there are no

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: tongues else for's turn.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: This lapwing runs away with the shell on his head.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: He did comply with his dug, before he sucked it.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thus has he--and many more of the same bevy that I

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: know the dressy age dotes on--only got the tune of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: the time and outward habit of encounter; a kind of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: yesty collection, which carries them through and

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: through the most fond and winnowed opinions; and do

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: but blow them to their trial, the bubbles are out.
Enter a Lord

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: My lord, his majesty commended him to you by young

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: Osric, who brings back to him that you attend him in

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: the hall: he sends to know if your pleasure hold to

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: play with Laertes, or that you will take longer time.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I am constant to my purpose; they follow the king's

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: pleasure: if his fitness speaks, mine is ready; now

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: or whensoever, provided I be so able as now.

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: The king and queen and all are coming down.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: In happy time.

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: The queen desires you to use some gentle

sceneText.speaker: Lord
sceneText.text: entertainment to Laertes before you fall to play.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: She well instructs me.
Exit Lord

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: You will lose this wager, my lord.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I do not think so: since he went into France, I

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: have been in continual practise: I shall win at the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: odds. But thou wouldst not think how ill all's here

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: about my heart: but it is no matter.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Nay, good my lord,--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: It is but foolery; but it is such a kind of

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: gain-giving, as would perhaps trouble a woman.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: If your mind dislike any thing, obey it: I will

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: forestall their repair hither, and say you are not

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: fit.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Not a whit, we defy augury: there's a special

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: providence in the fall of a sparrow. If it be now,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: 'tis not to come; if it be not to come, it will be

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: now; if it be not now, yet it will come: the

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: readiness is all: since no man has aught of what he

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: leaves, what is't to leave betimes?
Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, LAERTES, Lords, OSRIC, and Attendants with foils, & c

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Come, Hamlet, come, and take this hand from me.
KING CLAUDIUS puts LAERTES' hand into HAMLET's

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Give me your pardon, sir: I've done you wrong;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But pardon't, as you are a gentleman.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This presence knows,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And you must needs have heard, how I am punish'd

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: With sore distraction. What I have done,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That might your nature, honour and exception

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Roughly awake, I here proclaim was madness.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Was't Hamlet wrong'd Laertes? Never Hamlet:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If Hamlet from himself be ta'en away,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And when he's not himself does wrong Laertes,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then Hamlet does it not, Hamlet denies it.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Who does it, then? His madness: if't be so,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Hamlet is of the faction that is wrong'd;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: His madness is poor Hamlet's enemy.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Sir, in this audience,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Let my disclaiming from a purposed evil

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Free me so far in your most generous thoughts,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That I have shot mine arrow o'er the house,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And hurt my brother.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I am satisfied in nature,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Whose motive, in this case, should stir me most

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: To my revenge: but in my terms of honour

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I stand aloof; and will no reconcilement,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Till by some elder masters, of known honour,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I have a voice and precedent of peace,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: To keep my name ungored. But till that time,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I do receive your offer'd love like love,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: And will not wrong it.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I embrace it freely;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And will this brother's wager frankly play.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Give us the foils. Come on.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Come, one for me.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll be your foil, Laertes: in mine ignorance

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Your skill shall, like a star i' the darkest night,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Stick fiery off indeed.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: You mock me, sir.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: No, by this hand.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Give them the foils, young Osric. Cousin Hamlet,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: You know the wager?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Very well, my lord

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Your grace hath laid the odds o' the weaker side.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I do not fear it; I have seen you both:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: But since he is better'd, we have therefore odds.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: This is too heavy, let me see another.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: This likes me well. These foils have all a length?
They prepare to play

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Ay, my good lord.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Set me the stoops of wine upon that table.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: If Hamlet give the first or second hit,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Or quit in answer of the third exchange,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Let all the battlements their ordnance fire:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The king shall drink to Hamlet's better breath;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And in the cup an union shall he throw,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Richer than that which four successive kings

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: In Denmark's crown have worn. Give me the cups;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And let the kettle to the trumpet speak,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The trumpet to the cannoneer without,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: The cannons to the heavens, the heavens to earth,

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: 'Now the king dunks to Hamlet.' Come, begin:

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: And you, the judges, bear a wary eye.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Come on, sir.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Come, my lord.
They play

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: One.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: No.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Judgment.

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: A hit, a very palpable hit.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Well; again.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Stay; give me drink. Hamlet, this pearl is thine;

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Here's to thy health.
Trumpets sound, and cannon shot off within

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Give him the cup.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I'll play this bout first; set it by awhile. Come.
They play

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Another hit; what say you?

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: A touch, a touch, I do confess.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Our son shall win.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: He's fat, and scant of breath.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Here, Hamlet, take my napkin, rub thy brows;

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: The queen carouses to thy fortune, Hamlet.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Good madam!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Gertrude, do not drink.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: I will, my lord; I pray you, pardon me.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: [Aside] It is the poison'd cup: it is too late.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I dare not drink yet, madam; by and by.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: Come, let me wipe thy face.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: My lord, I'll hit him now.

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: I do not think't.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: [Aside] And yet 'tis almost 'gainst my conscience.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Come, for the third, Laertes: you but dally;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I pray you, pass with your best violence;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I am afeard you make a wanton of me.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Say you so? come on.
They play

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Nothing, neither way.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Have at you now!
LAERTES wounds HAMLET; then in scuffling, they change rapiers, and HAMLET wounds LAERTES

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: Part them; they are incensed.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Nay, come, again.
QUEEN GERTRUDE falls

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Look to the queen there, ho!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: They bleed on both sides. How is it, my lord?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: How is't, Laertes?

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Why, as a woodcock to mine own springe, Osric;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I am justly kill'd with mine own treachery.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: How does the queen?

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: She swounds to see them bleed.

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: No, no, the drink, the drink,--O my dear Hamlet,--

sceneText.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
sceneText.text: The drink, the drink! I am poison'd.
Dies

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O villany! Ho! let the door be lock'd:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Treachery! Seek it out.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: It is here, Hamlet: Hamlet, thou art slain;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: No medicine in the world can do thee good;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: In thee there is not half an hour of life;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: The treacherous instrument is in thy hand,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Unbated and envenom'd: the foul practise

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Hath turn'd itself on me lo, here I lie,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Never to rise again: thy mother's poison'd:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: I can no more: the king, the king's to blame.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The point!--envenom'd too!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Then, venom, to thy work.
Stabs KING CLAUDIUS

sceneText.speaker: All
sceneText.text: Treason! treason!

sceneText.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
sceneText.text: O, yet defend me, friends; I am but hurt.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Here, thou incestuous, murderous, damned Dane,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Drink off this potion. Is thy union here?

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Follow my mother.
KING CLAUDIUS dies

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: He is justly served;

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: It is a poison temper'd by himself.

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Exchange forgiveness with me, noble Hamlet:

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Mine and my father's death come not upon thee,

sceneText.speaker: LAERTES
sceneText.text: Nor thine on me.
Dies

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Heaven make thee free of it! I follow thee.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I am dead, Horatio. Wretched queen, adieu!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: You that look pale and tremble at this chance,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: That are but mutes or audience to this act,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Had I but time--as this fell sergeant, death,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Is strict in his arrest--O, I could tell you--

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But let it be. Horatio, I am dead;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Thou livest; report me and my cause aright

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To the unsatisfied.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Never believe it:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: I am more an antique Roman than a Dane:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Here's yet some liquor left.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: As thou'rt a man,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Give me the cup: let go; by heaven, I'll have't.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O good Horatio, what a wounded name,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Things standing thus unknown, shall live behind me!

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: If thou didst ever hold me in thy heart

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Absent thee from felicity awhile,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: And in this harsh world draw thy breath in pain,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: To tell my story.
March afar off, and shot within

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: What warlike noise is this?

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: Young Fortinbras, with conquest come from Poland,

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: To the ambassadors of England gives

sceneText.speaker: OSRIC
sceneText.text: This warlike volley.

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: O, I die, Horatio;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: The potent poison quite o'er-crows my spirit:

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: I cannot live to hear the news from England;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: But I do prophesy the election lights

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: On Fortinbras: he has my dying voice;

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: So tell him, with the occurrents, more and less,

sceneText.speaker: HAMLET
sceneText.text: Which have solicited. The rest is silence.
Dies

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Now cracks a noble heart. Good night sweet prince:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest!

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Why does the drum come hither?
March within
Enter FORTINBRAS, the English Ambassadors, and others

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Where is this sight?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: What is it ye would see?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: If aught of woe or wonder, cease your search.

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: This quarry cries on havoc. O proud death,

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: What feast is toward in thine eternal cell,

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: That thou so many princes at a shot

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: So bloodily hast struck?

sceneText.speaker: First Ambassador
sceneText.text: The sight is dismal;

sceneText.speaker: First Ambassador
sceneText.text: And our affairs from England come too late:

sceneText.speaker: First Ambassador
sceneText.text: The ears are senseless that should give us hearing,

sceneText.speaker: First Ambassador
sceneText.text: To tell him his commandment is fulfill'd,

sceneText.speaker: First Ambassador
sceneText.text: That Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead:

sceneText.speaker: First Ambassador
sceneText.text: Where should we have our thanks?

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Not from his mouth,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Had it the ability of life to thank you:

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: He never gave commandment for their death.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But since, so jump upon this bloody question,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: You from the Polack wars, and you from England,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Are here arrived give order that these bodies

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: High on a stage be placed to the view;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And let me speak to the yet unknowing world

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: How these things came about: so shall you hear

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of carnal, bloody, and unnatural acts,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of accidental judgments, casual slaughters,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And, in this upshot, purposes mistook

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Fall'n on the inventors' reads: all this can I

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Truly deliver.

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Let us haste to hear it,

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: And call the noblest to the audience.

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: For me, with sorrow I embrace my fortune:

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: I have some rights of memory in this kingdom,

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Which now to claim my vantage doth invite me.

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Of that I shall have also cause to speak,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: And from his mouth whose voice will draw on more;

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: But let this same be presently perform'd,

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: Even while men's minds are wild; lest more mischance

sceneText.speaker: HORATIO
sceneText.text: On plots and errors, happen.

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Let four captains

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Bear Hamlet, like a soldier, to the stage;

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: For he was likely, had he been put on,

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: To have proved most royally: and, for his passage,

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: The soldiers' music and the rites of war

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Speak loudly for him.

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Take up the bodies: such a sight as this

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Becomes the field, but here shows much amiss.

sceneText.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
sceneText.text: Go, bid the soldiers shoot.
A dead march. Exeunt, bearing off the dead bodies; after which a peal of ordnance is shot off
